content_scrubbed:
It[.] easy to look back now and see the reality of it, but when I was younger and checking out colleges (while understanding absolutely none of it) I was told, "If you get this Liberal Arts degree in Communication you'll be able to find a job in television, radio, film, various other media outlets, marketing, advertising, or a talk show host." (Yes, talk show host was actually listed.)

So I majored in communication, looking forward to learning about all that shit and finding out how to follow up my education with a career. Eventually I realized that I was learning absolutely ZERO job skills. When I asked my department head about it I was told, "Our program is a research based program. We're teaching you all how to be researchers." Great! That[.] exactly what I was told would be happening! 

So yeah, it[.] real easy now that I'm older and actually understand how this shit works to look back and see how stupid it was to get a Communication degree. But when your entire life you're told you HAVE to go to college and get a degree if you want any worthwhile job, that[.] what you fucking do. Throw in the fact that most of us were 18 when we made that decision and now you have a bunch of 30-somethings that were too young and dumb to understand the choices they actually made.
